sentences.sContent: We spent three days in Paris.
sentences.sCn: 我们在巴黎度过了三天。

sentences.sContent: She only leaves her house during the day.
It was a cold blustery day.
sentences.sCn: 那是个寒风呼啸的冷天。

sentences.sContent: Kept in that dark cell, I could no longer tell whether it was day or night.
sentences.sCn: 我被关在那个漆黑的牢房里，不知是白天还是黑夜。

sentences.sContent: The day dawned (= started ) bright and clear.
...walk-throughs of every day of my life from waking to sleeping...
...Teamwork improves with time: America’s National Transportation Safety Board found that 73% of the incidents in its civil-aviation database occurred on a crew’s first day of flying together...
...A handful of people can recall almost every day of their lives in enormous detail—and after years of research...
...I could tell you everything about every day after that...
...going from about a pack a day to zero...
...I look forward to each day and experiencing something new...
...she claimed that she could recall every day of her life since the age of 12...
...the HSAM subjects are doing it day in...
...It seems to me that a compromise would be receiving the exam questions a day or two in advance...
...The report warns that 200 million poor workers are at risk of joining the ranks of people living on less than 2 dollars per day in the past three years...

phrases.pCn: （将来）有一天；总有一天；（过去）某一天
总有一天；将来有一天；来日
另一天，又一天；改日；吉日
